title: SB 181
content: The people of the State of California enact the following. The First Validating Act of 2015, also known as SECTION 1, defines "public body" to include various state departments, agencies, boards, commissions, cities, counties, districts, and other entities. This encompasses a wide range of organizations, such as air pollution control districts, airport districts, and assessment districts. Various districts and authorities in California are included in the definition of "public body," such as bridge and highway districts, water districts, pest control districts, city maintenance districts, community college districts, and more. The curr_chunk lists various types of districts and authorities in California that are considered as part of a "public body," including water authorities, fire protection districts, highway districts, housing authorities, and library districts. The curr_chunk lists various types of districts and authorities in California that are considered as part of a "public body," including irrigation districts, joint highway districts, levee districts, library districts, local agency formation commissions, local health care districts, local hospital districts, local transportation authorities, maintenance districts, memorial districts, metropolitan transportation commissions, metropolitan water districts, mosquito abatement and vector control districts, multifamily improvement districts, municipal improvement districts, municipal utility districts, municipal water districts, nonprofit corporations, nonprofit public benefit corporations, open-space maintenance districts, parking and business improvement areas, parking authorities, parking districts, permanent road divisions, pest abatement districts, police protection districts, port districts, property and business improvement areas, protection districts, public cemetery districts, and public utility districts. Protection districts, public cemetery districts, public utility districts, rapid transit districts, reclamation districts, recreation and park districts, regional justice facility financing agencies, regional park and open-space districts, regional planning districts, regional transportation commissions, resort improvement districts, resource conservation districts, river port districts, road maintenance districts, sanitary districts, school districts of any kind or class, school facilities improvement districts, separation of grade districts, service authorities for freeway emergencies, sewer districts, sewer maintenance districts, small craft harbor districts, special municipal tax districts, stone and pome fruit pest control districts, storm drain maintenance districts, storm drainage districts, storm drainage maintenance districts, storm water districts, toll tunnel authorities, traffic authorities, transit development boards, transit districts. The curr_chunk lists various public bodies including toll tunnel authorities, transit development boards, water agencies, and wine grape pest control districts. It also specifies exclusions such as community redevelopment agencies and community development commissions. The curr_chunk defines "Bonds" as instruments of indebtedness for public purposes, including borrowing money in anticipation of taxes or revenues. "Hereafter" refers to any time after the effective date of the act. SEC. 3 declares all public bodies previously organized under any law to be legally functioning with all rights and obligations. SEC. 4 confirms the boundaries of public bodies as previously established. SEC. 5 validates the boundaries shown on maps or plats used by the assessor. SEC. 5 confirms and validates all past actions taken by public bodies regarding annexation, inclusion, detachment, consolidation, merger, or dissolution of territories. SEC. 6 authorizes, confirms, and validates all past actions related to the issuance of bonds by public bodies for public purposes. All bonds issued by public bodies are legally binding obligations, whether previously issued, sold, authorized by ordinance, resolution, order, or through an election. Bonds authorized by a public body through an election are legally binding obligations. SEC. 7 of this act validates past acts and proceedings within constitutional limits, excluding those currently under legal dispute. This act does not legalize any act previously determined to be illegal, void, or ineffective, nor does it authorize contracts between public bodies and the United States. Any challenge to the validity of actions taken under laws related to the formation, organization, or boundaries of public bodies must be filed within six months of this act's effective date. Failure to do so will deem those actions valid and legally binding. This act does not extend the time limit for legal action beyond what is already barred by statutes of limitations or laches. The curr_chunk states that it allows for legal action beyond the period barred by existing statutes of limitations. The curr_chunk clarifies that the creation or boundary changes of public bodies must be filed in accordance with specific government code sections for assessment or taxation purposes. It also declares the act as urgent for validating public bodies promptly.
